Title: Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
ARE YOU READY TO WORK AT ALTISOURCE?


Are you looking for an opportunity to advance your career in data analysis?
Do you enjoy solving complex business problems using financial and sales data?
Are you excited to join a growing team and take on exciting challenges?

If so, Altisource would love to hear from you! Altisource is seeking a Data Analyst to use data to build and execute a client retention and lead generation strategy. This includes building a database to run overall data modeling to measure and address client lead generation. The Junior Data Analyst will use large complex sets of data that will need to be mined and manipulated in order to make important business decisions.

WHAT YOU GET TO DO


Use a variety of technologies ( SQL Server, Oracle, Visual Studio, Microstrategy, Salesforce) and business data to help support client base
Help maintain database to track and report on key client & corporate metrics to drive retention, improve efficiency, and enhance value to all stakeholders
Use data to run a variety of analytics models that can help drive decision-making for both tactical and strategic purposes including assessments of existing products, new products, client consultation, and process improvement
Participate in the design and implementation of lean reporting processes and initiatives within databases and CRM's

WHAT ABOUT YOU? You have...


Knowledge in creating SQL queries is highly beneficial. Exposure to Tableau, major databases (Oracle & SQL Server), and CRM's (Salesforce)
Strong reporting skills in MS Excel (pivot tables, macros, etc.) and MS Access
A highly analytical ability, yet skilled at distilling complex ideas and data into meaningful and actionable business insights
An ability to manage large, complex sets of data that need to be mined and manipulated in order to make important business decisions

WORKING AT ALTISOURCE ADVANTAGES:
Prosperity


Competitive base salaries!
401k plans with company match – we want to empower you to further your career, and prepare for retirement!

Good Health


Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance plans
Tax-free Flexible Spending Account
Life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability

And Happiness


Paid holidays, plus 19 days of accrued PTO for a total of 28 paid days off per year!
Free snacks, drinks and coffee!
Plenty of employee engagement activities including sporting events, happy hours, and other fun team-building activities
Opportunities to join our community service initiatives, including Habitat for Humanity
Employee Discounts on movie tickets, Verizon cell service, Microsoft products, and more!

OUR CORE VALUES

For our employees, customers, and shareholders, we commit to…


Act With Integrity – exhibit unwavering integrity, compliance and ethical conduct at all times
Energize People – enable exceptional people to energize their teams and drive results
Empower Innovation – reward the relentless creation of innovative and compliant solutions to achieve our mission and generate value for our customers
Exceed Customer Expectations – execute world-class solutions to deliver value and delight our customers
Win as a Team – embrace the passion, energy and power of our global teams to win as "One-Altisource"
Enrich Communities – create positive impacts for the communities where we live and serve

Are you up to the challenge? Apply today!

Reach out to our Talent Acquisition Team directly at working@altisource.com if we can be of any assistance!

Title: Director of Nursing Research
FullDescriptions:
The Director of Nursing Research coordinates, manages and provides subject matter expertise in the development, design and implementation of nursing research projects across Baylor Scott & White Health (BSWH). The Director manages multiple research projects and teams and makes the challenge of research a reality for staff nurses. The Director provides leadership in provision of training and consultation to support individual or teams in research projects that promote and advance the use of research-based practice. In addition, the Director provides leadership in the translation of research findings into nursing practice and the profession to promote evidence based practice across the BSWH System. Data Analyst and Nurse Scientists will either direct or matrix report to this position. This position will advance Nursing and Interprofessional research across the System to align to BSWH Mission/Vision/Values and promote optimal staff and clinical outcomes. This position scope of responsibility is BSWH System and will require travel. Other essential functions of the role include the following:
Collaborates with chief nursing officers and other nurse leaders, including staff nurses, to identify nursing research studies that align with the strategic direction of the organization.
Develops educational programs supporting translation of the research process into practical steps for nursing staff, supporting professional growth and skill development.
Leads the development and design of research studies; serves as an expert in research design, methodologies and processes in collaboration with nurse scientists across the system.
Responsibility for maintaining system registry and annual reporting of all Nursing Research & Publications
Provides knowledge and expertise in the area of statistical and qualitative data analysis.
Develops or assists in the development of curriculum relative to research; conducts training and/or oversees delivery of training.
Partners with the BSWH Foundations to develop proposals to fund nursing research initiatives.
Builds partnerships with local nursing schools to promote collaboration on research projects among faculty and BSWH nurses.
Leadership in collaborating with CNOs and Magnet Coordinators in meeting research requirements for Magnet designation to ensure all organizations are meeting Magnet Standards for Nursing Research.


The ideal candidate will have knowledge and expertise in the area of nursing research studies, annual reporting, funding and grant proposals, collaborating with various constituents and members of leadership and driving results. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication, leadership, and analytical skills.
Benefits Our competitive benefits package includes*:
Immediate eligibility for health and welfare benefits
401(k) savings plan with dollar-for-dollar match up to 5%
Tuition Reimbursement
PTO accrual beginning Day 1


Note: Benefits may vary based upon position type and/or level.

5 8 years of related experience required
Registered Nurse (RN) license required

Who is Foodbuy?
We are the industry leader in procurement and supply chain solutions. We are the subsidiary to the 6th largest company in the world (Compass Group PLC), yet Foodbuy has the feel of a small entrepreneurial Company. We pride ourselves on our ability to source and provide a variety of products and services that help our customers more easily, and cost effectively, run their businesses. We work with clients in the Hospitality, Restaurant, Healthcare, Education, Entertainment, and Gaming industries, and of course we support Compass Group- which is the world’s largest contract food and support services provider.

Why Foodbuy?
We care about our associates, our clients, and our community. We think big, encourage innovation and debate, and seek out game changers. Our benefits and PTO offerings are strong. Our compensation packages are competitive. And we are constantly growing, and we want our associates’ careers to grow along with us. #Foodbuy
Job Summary
The Market Data Analyst will support the Member Development Group Vice Presidents, Account Managers and specifically designated channels of business through creating & maintaining detailed reporting assignments/applications. The Market Data Analyst is responsible for managing multiple projects and assignments by generating insights & analyzing information to help the organization better understand the past, envision the future, and steward our financial resources in the best way possible. This role will focus on understanding key stakeholder questions across the business in order to design and create reports/dashboards and reports that transform data into meaningful, actionable insights. This role will require creativity, an analytical skillset and clear communication to tell compelling stories about how our business is performing. You will also assist in automation of reports and dashboards, develop and maintain key metrics and scorecards, communicate findings, and train others on how to leverage the provided data across the business. Consistently displays strong integrity and ethics

Title: EBI Data Analyst II
FullDescriptions:
The EBI Data Analyst II is responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements, design requirements, test cases and scripts, test plans, and facilitating in user acceptance testing for Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence solutions. The EBI Data Analyst II will work with other technical team members to deploy solutions based on departmental documentation and testing standards and will communicate/interact with end-users individually as needed without direct supervision within the scope of their assigned tasks. The EBI Data Analyst II will also have the following responsibilities including but not limited to:
Document and gather detailed business requirements for data, reporting, and business intelligence solutions
Document and gather the following for data, reporting, and business intelligence solutions: detailed functional design specifications, detailed data design specifications, and detailed ETL specifications for Data Warehousing interfaces, extracts, staging areas, atomic areas, and mart database environments
Develop test cases and SQL test scripts based on detailed data design, detailed functional design, and ETL specifications
Execute QA data and functional test activities including performing root cause analysis and managing the resolution of defects.
Manage the resolution of project and support issues within the scope of assigned tasks.
Take ownership and be fully accountable for assigned support of existing applications including: keeping end-user contact lists up to date, keeping communications of Service Level Agreements up to date, and evaluating and scoping new requests and incidents.



The ideal EBI Data Analyst II holds a Bachelors Degree combined with a minimum of 3 years of experience in Data Warehousing, ODS, or other reporting environment within one of the following industries: Healthcare, Supply Chain, or Finance. The ideal EBI Data Analyst II will be experienced in writing SQL queries against relational databases of moderate to high complexity and will be experienced with Agile/SCRUM SDLC. The ideal EBI Data Analyst II will possess exceptional documentation and communication skills in addition to the ability to effectively interact and collaborate with a diverse group of professionals within a team environment.
Location/Facility Baylor Scott & White Health, Dallas

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, statistics, or other related field. Ability to manage multiple assignments. Superior written and oral communication skills. 6-10+ years of experience.

Extensive experience in NO-SQL, SQL database, and Data Grid in Cloud environment: CassandraWrite high-performance queries to run on SQL and NO-SQL databases.Must be adept in development of high-performance queries to run on SQL and NO-SQL databases.Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reports.Work with management team to create a prioritized list of needs for each business segment.Capability to work with a team of data analysts to derive necessary information from data sets.Use data to create models that depict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a whole.Organize data in a standard format that is quick and efficient to display graphically.Knowledge of tools like Tableau, ELK, and Spreadsheet to showcase data aggregates is a big plus.Be able to interview users to find requirements for programming, documentation and execution on those requirements.Recognize architectural improvements needed to improve APU Programming.Perform any query based programming or data consolidation related task independently and efficiently.Think strategically about existing or conceptual opportunities.Mentor and direct other programming staff members in a clear and articulate manner.

Apply today to learn more and be part of our Growth story.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
What you’ll be doing...
You’ll join the Network Equipment Repair Team where you will be responsible for overseeing third-party repair and warranty returns for network equipment. This equipment is reused throughout the network and allows for nearly three hundred million dollars in new purchase cost avoidance. You’ll be part of a team of individuals who work daily with OEMs, third party vendors, and engineering teams to process a high volume of repairs and improve quality to bolster network reliability. Working across the company, you’ll use your analytical expertise to identify trends, issues and opportunities, all with the goal of improving the customer experience and finding ways to make our business even better. While maintaining day to day operations is imperative, you’ll also develop and manage large scale data transformational projects/programs through the IT teams.
Partner with third parties to ensure repair capabilities for select network equipment.
Develop automated dashboards and metrics to measure on-time delivery and repair quality
Mine, Analyze and transform large data sets to optimize the reverse logistics process using SQL, Tableau and OBIEE.
Identifying areas for improvement, incorporating best-in-class and cutting-edge techniques, and designing new approaches and methodologies.
Creating results presentations for senior management that provide key business insights.
Provide quick turnaround for AD-HOC reports required by the team to support cost reduction efforts
Issue RFPs for new equipment pricing and improvements over existing pricing.
Develop improvement programs featuring quarterly business reviews and other periodic check-ins to foster an environment of constant communication and collaboration.
Automate and optimize current manual processes tied to the management of spare and warehouse inventory and repairs
Continue ongoing programs to provide better visibility into repair orders via data analytics
Coordinate with warehouse to resolve receiving and shipping issues as well as providing proper target metrics
Enhance current system functionality to allow for repair order process automation and reduce manual efforts.
Develop management-by-exception tools by utilizing technology to flag data abnormalities.
Benchmark Verizon to other vendors in and out of industry using metrics such as TL9000.
Create automated data sharing paths between third party vendors, OEM’s and Verizon internal systems to facilitate process visibility
Create and monitor IT change requests to enhance internal system functionality
Proactively engage stakeholders to ensure current and future needs are met.
Lead and influence cross-functional teams in the design and implementation of transformative programs.
Continually improve knowledge base of network equipment and repair capabilities.
Work with field teams to effectively communicate proper handling for equipment based on vendor feedback.
Request and maintain purchase orders for all repair vendors and OEM's.
Identify and execute re-certification of returned decommissioned assets from the field.
Coordinate with engineering teams on planned decoms to ensure proper treatment of decommissioned asset
What we’re looking for...
You are good with numbers and you love to dig into data to find the story. Designing reports and spreadsheets is a fun afternoon for you. You are detail-oriented and know how to focus on what really matters. You understand the importance of accuracy in data analytics and reporting. You are a self-starter and a multi-tasker who can work independently under tight timelines. You want to make an impact by providing the data that will help improve the experience of our customers.
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience
Three or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience with Microsoft Excel (pivot tables and charting) and PowerPoint.
Experience with data mining, data analytics, building reports and presentations, and making recommendations.
Willingness to travel.
Even better if you have:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical, Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain, Data Science or related discipline.
Ability to work with multiple cross functional teams on many different projects simultaneously.
Personality and character to foster a firm but fair relationship with our external vendors and OEMs.
Experience managing vendors, issuing RFPs and negotiating contract terms like pricing.
Worked with Teradata, SQL, Hadoop, OBIEE, and Tableau.
Knowledge of repair and manufacturing processes.
Knowledge with Advanced Statistical Modeling.
Results oriented and deadline driven mindset.
Program/project management.
Reverse supply chain and/or repair experience.
Knowledge with ERP and/or inventory tracking/planning systems, such as SAP, PeopleSoft, CATS, COEP, etc.
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

Excellent Communication and Analytic Reasoning Skills

The Data Risk Analyst serves as the vanguard of the Portfolio Risk Analytics team and will be primarily responsible for developing an intimate understanding of the data and associated metrics that PRA uses. The Data Risk Analyst will be the primary liaison for data related questions and analysis, and will have opportunities to develop new processes and reporting.

Job Responsibilities

Build portfolio Trends for Ally Auto finance cutting across Originations and Servicing
Create and maintain reporting tools in a wide variety of programs in order to analyze and monitor asset quality and financial data
Communicate across cross functional teams to acquire and consolidate necessary information
Work in conjunction with other team members to create pertinent and informative analysis

Promote a strong risk culture by using constructive dissent to appropriately challenge using data and analysis.

Required:

Must have a positive attitude and a willingness to learn
3-5 years of Consumer Finance industry experience, (e.g. auto, card, mortgage etc.)
Candidate must have strong communication skills, especially with regards to explaining data
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics , Mathematics, Computer Science or other quantitative fields
Comfort with extracting, manipulating, and presenting large volumes of data

Business Unit Description

Portfolio Risk Analytics (PRA) serves as the premier watchdog for senior management. PRA is comprised of individuals from diverse backgrounds across the Financial Services spectrum, with extensive experience in a multitude of industries. As the eyes and ears of Consumer Asset Management (CAM), we interact with a wide variety of business partners across the organization in order to monitor, analyze, and identify risk.

Ally Overview

Ally Financial Inc. is a leading automotive financial services company powered by a top direct banking franchise with the opportunity, experience and people to redefine the industry.

Ally's automotive services business offers a full suite of financing products and services, including new and used vehicle inventory and consumer financing, leasing, inventory insurance, commercial loans and vehicle remarketing services. Ally Bank, the company's direct banking subsidiary and member FDIC, offers an array of deposit products, including certificates of deposit, savings accounts, money market accounts, IRA deposit products and interest checking. Ally's Commercial Finance unit provides financing to middle-market companies across a broad range of industries.

Total Rewards Information

Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and bonus pay potential based on achieving personal and company goals. Plus, we have a flexible paid-time-off program with an emphasis on work-life balance. Ally offers a variety of benefits to protect your health and well-being, provide financial security and balance your work/life needs including:

Industry-leading 401K Retirement Savings Plan including Matching and Company Contributions
Comprehensive wellness program and wellness rewards to help you reach your personal health goals
Flexible health insurance options including dental and vision
Pre-tax health savings, dependent care and commuter transit accounts
Life and disability benefits
Other work/life benefits including tuition reimbursement, adoption assistance, weight watchers and employee discount programs.

Position Overview
Commercial Metals Company is currently seeking a Data Analyst to assist in the design and execution of data analytic solutions for all of CMC’s lines of business. This person must be an excellent hands-on analyst that can mine, compile, interpret, and visualize complex data sets from many data sources – often covering multiple lines of business. The ideal candidate should be adept at transforming these complex data sets into intuitive, readable reports and/or dashboards. The candidate should be able to identify trends and possible opportunities for growth for the targeted CMC line of business/department/segment. The candidate must be able to participate within a team environment to identify and build strategic solutions to provide stakeholders with the necessary information to make key business decisions. This participation includes requirement gathering, status updates, execution, delivery and support of all data analytic deliverables and platforms.
This person must be a well-rounded data analyst professional who has the ability to connect the dots between business needs and technology. The candidate must possess the necessary soft skills to successfully collaborate with many different stakeholders and senior leadership to drive strategic decision. Strong work ethic and program management skills is a must as this person will be expected to simultaneously participate in multiple projects through completion, resulting with high-quality end-deliverables.

Title: Web Developer, BI Reporting
FullDescriptions:
Job Description

As a Business Intelligence Report Developer, you will be the champion of OT reporting and intranet development. You will have the opportunity to develop a single source of truth to support then entire OT organization including senior leadership. We are looking for an enthusiastic, curious, and innovative team member with a drive to deliver quality initiatives and who is detail oriented. You will work closely with the larger Business Intelligence and Analysis team in the support of the Enterprise Data Assets team to develop web based and PowerBI reporting which will utilize a variety of data sources. In addition, you will help to support legacy reporting and research questions on all reporting originating from the Business Intelligence team.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Understand your business stakeholders’ objectives, key metrics, and how they measure their performance.
Develop adhoc reporting utilizing various tools such as SQL, Microsoft Office (Excel), Power BI, MS Visual Studio and similar tools.
Deep expertise and hands on experience with Web Applications and programming languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, C#, .NET and API's.
Act as the subject matter expert of business data, database structures, business rules and the owner of intranet development and support.
Utilize best practices displaying large amounts of data visually and effectively, while adequately documenting analysis, designs and results.
Deep functional knowledge or hands on design experience with Web Services is needed to be successful in this position.
Strong grasp of security principles and how they apply to E-Commerce applications is a plus.
Meet with internal customers to gather required reporting and dashboard requirements, working with them to identify and close requirement gaps.
Identify and understand the correct data sources for a given analysis.
Create technical documentation for adhoc reporting and data request on an as-needed basis.
Identify opportunities to automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes.
Coordinate code reviews with data analysts to ensure quality of data.
Train analysts and business users on report usage and interpretation.

Qualifications

5+ years of recent experience business intelligence or comparable data engineering role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technologies.
Demonstrated experience in a report development, business analytics, business intelligence or comparable role, with proven experience as a report, campaign/list pull, or data analyst.
Utilize business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview and more.
Proven ability to guide customers in refining data needs.
Ability to facilitate information and requirements gathering sessions.
Ability to write and troubleshoot new and existing SQL queries.
Ability to write and troubleshoot new and existing intranet web reports
Performance tuning/Optimization experience related to reporting queries.
Experience working with a star-schema data warehouse.
Knowledgeable of Microsoft Office with an advanced knowledge of Excel.
Experience using Jira or other workflow management tool.
Advanced experience working with SQL Server Management Studio.
Advanced experience working with Microsoft Visual Studio
Experience with Microsoft business intelligence tools, techniques and technologies a plus - SQL Server, SSRS & PowerBI.
Previous working knowledge and highly proficient in HTML, VB.NET, C#, JavaScript, jQuery and other Front-End Technologies.
Familiar with Development and Debugging tools for cross-browser issues.
Show confidence in work relationships and be responsible for making others aware of issues, delays and other needs.
Additional Information

One Technologies offers attractive compensation, 100% company-paid health and dental insurance, short term and long-term disability coverage, paid health club membership, tuition reimbursement and flexible working hours in a casual, open, creative environment.

One Technologies does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias, company recruiters or other One Technologies employees. One Technologies is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job Summary
The business analyst’s primary objective is supporting the University in implementing technology projects. Implementing projects cost-effectively by documenting program/project requirements, documenting & organizing Change Management components (communications, training, UAT), defines and manages program/project data, and communicates this clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners. This position works closely with and under the immediate direction of the Program/Project Manager.

Business Case & Scope of Work: Under general direction, formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on both user needs and a good understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements. Business Process Review: Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time, and form of desired results. Requirements Gathering & Specification: Analyzes of business and user needs, documents requirements, and translates data into proper system requirement specifications based on identified project methodology approach. Outcomes Definition & Management: Leads stakeholders in defining desired outcomes, assigning success measures, creating test cases to prove achievability of outcome attainment prior to go-live, and measurement of outcomes post implement to ensure project achieve outcomes. Other duties as assigned.

Bachelor degree in one of the following areas: computer technology, business management, management information or computer systems. 4 to 5 years of support and analysis experience; or the equivalent experience. A strong understanding and application of assessing project, business and/or program requirements and developing technical solutions is needed. Working knowledge of preparing test cases for technology alignment, and the ability to convert the requests from business users and management into a workable solution to present to technology staff. Strong MS Office skills (Word, Excel, and Visio) are required. Two or more years’ experience working with Web design and development. Strong understanding of modern web design mythology. Excellent organization, teamwork, problem solving, presentation, customer service and communication (verbal and written) skills.

Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in any of the areas above and/or IT Certification in Business Analysis with 6+ years of developing business requirements and test case scenarios. Experience with Agile and other Project Management methodologies. Experience working with modern Web Technologies, Content Management Systems and Web Design. Experience working in the Higher Education field.

Title: Health and Benefits Analyst - University - DAL
FullDescriptions:
Create your future. Our Health and Benefits business helps large and mid-size clients control soaring health and welfare plan costs, improve health outcomes and promote employee engagement through broad-based, state-of-the-art interventions. We provide solutions encompassing creative plan design, vendor evaluation and management, pricing and funding strategies, data analytics, valuation support, and legal compliance and governance strategies. We also provide specialty consulting services including clinical/health management program design, pharmacy solutions, disability/absence management strategies and claims audit services. Product based solutions such as our pharmacy purchasing coalition round out our broad-based suite of offerings.
Explore an opportunity. As a Health and Benefits Analyst, you will work beside some of the industry’s top consultants while you progress toward becoming a thought leader of the future.

You will have immediate exposure to real client assignments which will draw on your imagination and creativity as well as your ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and present results. These experiences will help build your technical knowledge and overall industry expertise.

For Actuarial track: Accepted applicants will be eligible for a comprehensive exam study program, including paid study hours and exam coaching to assist in attaining the accredited designation of Actuary.

Love your work. You will partner with consultants to provide support on projects through:

Performing financial analyses, including developing pricing, creating employee contribution strategies, modelling plan design alternatives, and calculating reserves
Analyzing and comparing vendor products, services, and contracts
Designing, distributing, and evaluating responses to surveys and RFPs
About you.
Bachelors or Master’s degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, public health, health management, actuarial science or any other major with significant quantitative course work with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0
For Actuarial students: Successful completion of one or more actuarial exams highly preferred
Work experience that demonstrates strong technical and/or client service skills (analyst type of internship preferred)
Passion for solving problems and sharing solutions to exceed the standards of the client
Ability to be a self-starter and work independently, but also cooperatively in a close team environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Excellent Microsoft Office skills, particularly in Excel
Equal Opportunity Employer/Vet/Disability

Title: Data Analyst - Data Science
Responsibilities:
Work with leadership to understand needs and align those to potential data and analytics efforts for building data science and analytical solutions using Spark, Scala, Hadoop, R, Python, Alteryx for Data Analytics initiatives.
Demonstrates to internal and external stakeholders how analytics can be implemented to maximize business benefits (predictive segmentation, survival modelling, media mix modelling). Provides technical support, which includes strategic consulting, needs assessments, project scoping and the preparation/presentation of analytical proposals.
Apply highly developed analytical skills to work on all aspects of the life insurance value chain, ranging from risk models, fraud detection, process triaging, and marketing predictions to a variety of other analytics solutions.
Explore big data technology (Hive, Storm, Mahout) and NoSQL (mongoDB, Neo4j, Giraph) platforms to evaluate and implement optimal, effective and long-term scalable database solutions in complex areas of agent hierarchy and commissions
Build Analytics expertise using advanced statistical modeling techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, survival analysis, GLM, tree models (Random Forests and GBM), cluster analysis (K-Means, SVM, GMM’s), principal components, feature creation, and validation
Help develop a data center of excellence to aid the vision of improving overall customer experience by data enrichment, engineering and artificial intelligence (Neural Networks) to support business with the right leads for each customer to improve cross-sell, reduce lapses and customer satisfaction
Test new statistical analysis methods, software and data sources using appropriate regularization techniques (Ridge, Lasso, elastic nets), variable selection techniques, feature creation (transformation, binning, high level categorical reduction, etc.) and validation (hold-outs, CV, bootstrap) for continual improvement of quantitative solutions.
Follow industry trends in insurance and related data/analytics processes and businesses. Share knowledge within Analytics group. Follow software practices that produce maintainable code, including automated testing, continuous integration, code style conformity, and code review
Actively participate in proof of concept tests of new data, software and technologies. Assure compliance with regulatory and privacy requirements during design and implementation of modeling and analytics projects. Resolve problems and obstacles to timely and high-quality project completion.
Proactively and effectively communicate insights using data visualization tools (Tableau, R Shiny, Jupyter, D3) and various verbal and written formats with internal stakeholders on product design, data specification, model implementations, with partners on collaboration ideas and specifics, with clients and account teams on project/test results, opportunities, questions.
Promote a data-driven culture through ongoing partnership and dialog with the business

FullDescriptions:
Req ID: 48430

At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.

NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Data Analyst - Data Science to join our team in Addison, Texas (US-TX), United States (US).

Responsibilities:
Work with leadership to understand needs and align those to potential data and analytics efforts for building data science and analytical solutions using Spark, Scala, Hadoop, R, Python, Alteryx for Data Analytics initiatives.
Demonstrates to internal and external stakeholders how analytics can be implemented to maximize business benefits (predictive segmentation, survival modelling, media mix modelling). Provides technical support, which includes strategic consulting, needs assessments, project scoping and the preparation/presentation of analytical proposals.
Apply highly developed analytical skills to work on all aspects of the life insurance value chain, ranging from risk models, fraud detection, process triaging, and marketing predictions to a variety of other analytics solutions.
Explore big data technology (Hive, Storm, Mahout) and NoSQL (mongoDB, Neo4j, Giraph) platforms to evaluate and implement optimal, effective and long-term scalable database solutions in complex areas of agent hierarchy and commissions
Build Analytics expertise using advanced statistical modeling techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, survival analysis, GLM, tree models (Random Forests and GBM), cluster analysis (K-Means, SVM, GMM’s), principal components, feature creation, and validation
Help develop a data center of excellence to aid the vision of improving overall customer experience by data enrichment, engineering and artificial intelligence (Neural Networks) to support business with the right leads for each customer to improve cross-sell, reduce lapses and customer satisfaction
Test new statistical analysis methods, software and data sources using appropriate regularization techniques (Ridge, Lasso, elastic nets), variable selection techniques, feature creation (transformation, binning, high level categorical reduction, etc.) and validation (hold-outs, CV, bootstrap) for continual improvement of quantitative solutions.
Follow industry trends in insurance and related data/analytics processes and businesses. Share knowledge within Analytics group. Follow software practices that produce maintainable code, including automated testing, continuous integration, code style conformity, and code review
Actively participate in proof of concept tests of new data, software and technologies. Assure compliance with regulatory and privacy requirements during design and implementation of modeling and analytics projects. Resolve problems and obstacles to timely and high-quality project completion.
Proactively and effectively communicate insights using data visualization tools (Tableau, R Shiny, Jupyter, D3) and various verbal and written formats with internal stakeholders on product design, data specification, model implementations, with partners on collaboration ideas and specifics, with clients and account teams on project/test results, opportunities, questions.
Promote a data-driven culture through ongoing partnership and dialog with the business

Required:
1+ years Business Consulting-Data and Analytics
1+ years Data Mining
1+ years Python
1+ years R
1+ years Business Intelligence Analytics
1+ years Machine Learning/AI
1+ years BI Reporting-Tableau
This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.
About NTT DATA Services

NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.

NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.

NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.

Title: Database Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Intalytics, a leader in location-centric predictive analytics, is in search of a Database Analyst to support our emerging data team.

Our ideal candidate will have data processing experience supporting a variety of industries. This role is predominantly an internal role that is responsible for data assessment, processing, manipulation, and applying data standards for the organization. The ideal candidate must be personable, have strong problem-solving skills, impeccable attention to detail, solid written & verbal communication, and fully capable to adapt within a team setting.

ATTRIBUTES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Organization: Ability to manage multiple projects of varying complexity while balancing priorities, timelines, and stakeholder expectations.

Collaborative: Exceptional interpersonal skills, active participant in team meetings, and a willingness to adapt to scope revisions.

Problem Solver: . Display intellectual agility and organizational savvy to solve complex data issues and present solutions.

Detail Oriented: Highly accurate with assessments and tasks.

QUALIFICATIONS – PREFERRED

Bachelor’s degree
1+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst, ETL Developer, or similar role
2+ years of SQL query development
2+ years of data analysis/processing/manipulation
1+ year of Experience with Alteryx
1+ year experience in data modeling and skills (i.e. conceptual, logical and physical model design)
Proficient with Microsoft Excel, and PowerPoint
Familiar with MySQL, SQL Server, and scripting languages (.bat, powershell, .sh)
SKILLS and JOB FUNCTIONS

Ability to analyze and interpret complex data
Ability to explain complex concepts and research outputs in simple terms
Ability to focus in a fast paced, flexible environment
Ability to work independently and in a strong team environment
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Identify opportunities for efficiency gains through process improvement
Develop standard and ad hoc reporting as needed
Development and presentation of post project deliverables
Extract, load, and reconcile large amounts of data across multiple system platforms and sources
Outstanding written & verbal communication skills
Strong attention to detail and Quality Control
BENEFITS

Generous salary commensurate with skill level and qualifications
401K plan, with company match and immediate vesting
Medical and dental insurance
Competitive vacation package
LOCATION

This position is located in our Irving, TX office. Eligible candidates must be permanently authorized to work in the United States.

FullDescriptions:
CRM Marketing Data Analyst
This role is responsible for managing the marketing data and targeting activities within PDI Marketing Cloud Solutions in support of our proprietary Fuel Rewards program and in support of our white label convenience retail and grocery programs. This role is responsible for executing our segmentation and CRM targeting strategies, and reporting on the effectiveness of our marketing programs. Reporting to the Director of CRM, this role will work closely with PDI's analytics and BI reporting teams, the data teams within our technical organization, and with our CRM marketing teams.

Primary responsibilities include:
Executing our targeting and segmentation strategies for our complex CRM activities, including working with our customer analytics teams to execute their CRM targeting strategies
Writing and executing against Business Requirements Documents (BRDs) for complex email and push marketing campaigns.
Conducting SQL coding the ETL activities to load customer lists into our CRM and Loyalty platforms.
Publishing reports on the effectiveness of our marketing programs
Presenting reporting to internal and external stakeholders
Working with our technical and Analytic teams to cleanse marketing data, add new data elements to the CRM tools and provide data governance
Key Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Business, or related field
Expert SQL coding skills required
Three to five years as a data analyst, with marketing focus preferred
Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, high performance environment
Strong organizational and project management skills
Excellent Microsoft Powerpoint, Excel and written and verbal communication skills
Team player that is results oriented

FullDescriptions:
Our client, an IT consulting services firm and Microsoft Gold Partner has an immediate need for a professional to joing the team as a senior level Business Intelligence & Analytics Architect. We are seeking an individual who wants to be part of an energetic, innovative and successful team.

What you will do:

Create dashboards, reports, and spreadsheets that solve business problems.
Function as a solution architect and create sales opportunities by leveraging client relationships
Create data models that support Ad Hoc reporting and analysis.
Design, test, and implement data integration software.
Create intellectual property from scratch; revolutionize internal processes and offerings
Design, test, and implement descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive studies.
Understand our clients’ businesses and the enterprise information systems that run them.
Serve as clients’ trusted partner
Function as a hands-on data analyst with exceptional skills for manipulating data on a variety of platforms.

Assist the larger organizational community to manage projects, test information systems, and implement solutions across all our lines of business.

Title: Data Warehouse & ETL Developer
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related area

Five (5) years of experience developing and delivering business intelligence solutions and data architecture

Five (5) years of experience working with OLTP and OLAP database models

Experience applying Data Virtualization tools

Fluent in relational database concepts and flat file processing concepts

Comprehensive knowledge in software development lifecycle and methodologies (i.e. Agile)

Strong presentation and collaboration skills and ability to communicate job requirements, including formal written documentation

Strong problem solving, time management and organizational skills

Ability to travel up to 20%
Responsibilities:
Develops ETL within the department standards for achieving maximum performance, compliance and efficiency of the Data Warehouse and MDM ecosystem. By providing adhering to the Principle guideline documents, Architecture Models, ETL Flow Models and Data Models set forth by management and BI Solutions Architects.

Ensure accuracy and integrity of service-oriented architecture through analysis, coding, writing clear documentation and problem resolution. This will be achieved through the consistent review of issues and enhancements documented in the incident management and project management system.

Maintain in-depth up-to-date knowledge of standards, guidelines, and industry trends for Data Warehouse Architecture as it relates to reporting and operations by attending user groups and researching new software vendors in the market.

Participates in the planning for retirement of systems programs, and migration of systems infrastructure by providing current state and future state architectural diagrams.

Work closely with Business Intelligence Manager and Agile Scrum Master to ensure prioritization of corporate and departmental objectives within the portfolio management system.

Champion data quality, integrity and reliability throughout the department by designing data flow models and promoting development best practices with best of breed automation tools.

Provide mentoring to data analyst team members with issues needing technical expertise or complex systems and/or programming knowledge. Provide on-the-job training for new or less experienced data integration team members.

Provide recommendations for the ongoing assessment of database performance and the identification of problem areas by holding regularly scheduled reviews of code and monitoring software with the Architects within the team.

Work with Data and QA analysts to ensure that data, environment and code deployments meet the needs for Data Warehouse testing.
FullDescriptions:
Are you ready to join an organization where you can make an extraordinary impact every day?
Imagine all Americans enjoying ideal cardiovascular health free of heart disease and stroke. At the American Heart Association and American Stroke Association, we get to work toward that goal every day. Is it easy? No. Is it worthwhile? Absolutely.
This is satisfying and challenging work that makes a real difference in people's lives. We are where you can achieve professional growth with personal fulfillment. We are where you can connect people to making a lifesaving impact. We are where you can partner with individuals, schools, lawmakers, healthcare providers and others to ensure everyone has access to healthier lifestyle choices and proper healthcare. The American Heart Association is where you can make an extraordinary impact.
Responsibilities
The American Heart Association has an excellent job opportunity for a Data Warehouse & ETL Developer at our office located in Dallas, TX.
In this role, you will be responsible for delivering the vision of the department through process and development. Responsible for developing and delivering data warehouse infrastructure and integration in collaboration with architects, analysts and team members while working in an Agile environment.

Develops ETL within the department standards for achieving maximum performance, compliance and efficiency of the Data Warehouse and MDM ecosystem. By providing adhering to the Principle guideline documents, Architecture Models, ETL Flow Models and Data Models set forth by management and BI Solutions Architects.

Ensure accuracy and integrity of service-oriented architecture through analysis, coding, writing clear documentation and problem resolution. This will be achieved through the consistent review of issues and enhancements documented in the incident management and project management system.

Maintain in-depth up-to-date knowledge of standards, guidelines, and industry trends for Data Warehouse Architecture as it relates to reporting and operations by attending user groups and researching new software vendors in the market.

Participates in the planning for retirement of systems programs, and migration of systems infrastructure by providing current state and future state architectural diagrams.

Work closely with Business Intelligence Manager and Agile Scrum Master to ensure prioritization of corporate and departmental objectives within the portfolio management system.

Champion data quality, integrity and reliability throughout the department by designing data flow models and promoting development best practices with best of breed automation tools.

Provide mentoring to data analyst team members with issues needing technical expertise or complex systems and/or programming knowledge. Provide on-the-job training for new or less experienced data integration team members.

Provide recommendations for the ongoing assessment of database performance and the identification of problem areas by holding regularly scheduled reviews of code and monitoring software with the Architects within the team.

Work with Data and QA analysts to ensure that data, environment and code deployments meet the needs for Data Warehouse testing.

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related area

Five (5) years of experience developing and delivering business intelligence solutions and data architecture

Five (5) years of experience working with OLTP and OLAP database models

Experience applying Data Virtualization tools

Fluent in relational database concepts and flat file processing concepts

Comprehensive knowledge in software development lifecycle and methodologies (i.e. Agile)

Strong presentation and collaboration skills and ability to communicate job requirements, including formal written documentation

Strong problem solving, time management and organizational skills

Business Intelligence Technology: SSRS, Power BI, Tableau, MicroStrategy

ETL Technology: SSIS, DataStage, Informatica

Time series analysis, clustering, decision trees and neural networks

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree
At least 2 year of experience in at least one scripting language
At least 3 year of experience in querying and analyzing and working with data languages and platforms
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree

FullDescriptions:
We are actively seeking multiple Senior Data Analysts at our Plano, TX location!

Analytical Mechanics Associates, Inc., (AMA) is proud of our customer relationships, our diverse and dynamic work environment, and our employees' career satisfaction. AMA is a small business specializing in aerospace engineering, business analytics, information technology, and visualization solutions. AMA combines the best of engineering and mathematics capabilities with the latest in information technologies and visualization to build creative solutions. Headquartered in Hampton, VA, AMA has operations in Huntsville, AL; Dallas and Houston, TX; Denver, CO; Santa Clara and Mountain View, CA; New Orleans, LA; and Hancock County, MS. We offer a competitive salary and attractive benefits package. Our website describes our corporate values and how they apply to the professional success and growth of our employees.

Job Description
Analytical Mechanics Associates, Inc. (AMA) is actively seeking multiple Senior Data Analysts at our Plano, TX location. Project duration is 6-12 months with possible extensions. Projected hours are 40 per week. Key responsibilities include:

As a Senior Data Analyst you will leverage analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.
On any given day you will be challenged on three types of work – Innovation, Data Management and Business Intelligence:
Innovation

Use Open Source/Digital technologies to mine complex, voluminous, and different varieties of data sources and platforms
Build well-managed data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers
Demonstrate ability to explore and quickly grasp new technologies to progress varied initiatives
Business Intelligence

Partner with the business to provide consultancy and translate the business needs to design and develop tools, techniques, metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
Data Management

Drive an understanding and adherence to the principles of data quality management including metadata, lineage, and business definitions
Work collaboratively with appropriate Tech teams to manage security mechanisms and data access governance
Build and execute tools to monitor and report on data quality
Our ideal candidate will have:

Degree specialized in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics discipline
Strong SQL programming skills and knowledge of relational databases
Strong scripting experience in any one of - Python, Perl, JavaScript, Shell, R. Python , VBA
Experience working in Unix environment- shell scripting, job scheduling
Experience using version control software (GitHub, Sub-version)
Strong desire and experience with data in various forms (data warehouses/SQL, unstructured data environments, AWS S3, Hadoop)
Education and Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree
At least 2 year of experience in at least one scripting language
At least 3 year of experience in querying and analyzing and working with data languages and platforms
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics discipline
1+ years’ experience working BI reporting tools (i.e. Tableau and Business Objects)
1+ years of experience working within process management and improvement methodologies – Lean, Six Sigma, etc.
1+ years of experience working with and demonstrating knowledge of data governance, data quality management concepts and data quality tools (i.e. Informatica DQ)
1+ years of experience working with Agile development methodologies
We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

FullDescriptions:
The Audit & Assurance Marketplace & Risk Intelligence group (Marketplace & Risk Intelligence) is a small team within Deloitte’s Audit practice responsible for creating cutting-edge web-based applications and actionable market intelligence for our audit practitioners and leadership. The team consists of highly skilled UI designers, researchers, data analysts and developers. The work we do is agile, exciting and is a valued contribution to our audit practice. Our work is critical to support leadership strategic decision-making and enable excellent client service and growth of our Audit and Assurance practice.

The Marketplace& Risk Intelligence team is looking for an experienced “Data Quality Senior Manager”. In this new, internally-facing role, the Data Quality Senior Manager has overall responsibility for maintaining the high quality, completeness, consistency and accuracy of the data that is delivered across the US firm through several web-based applications in the Marketplace & Risk Intelligence application portfolio.
The Data Quality Senior Manager will interact regularly with our technical teams, researchers, analytics professionals, third party data providers, and audit business leaders. He or she will be involved end-to-end from the acquisition of data to the effective distribution of data. In addition, this position will include assisting the Market Intelligence Managing Director with overall team operations in a ‘chief of staff’ capacity.
The position will provide an excellent opportunity to build individual your network, develop relationships, increase exposure to audit leadership, and be a part of a team within a highly strategic focus area of the Audit Practice.

Work you'll do
Improves data quality through organizational, procedural and technological means. Develops new processes as needed to ensure ongoing protection of data quality.
Actively monitors data quality in Marketplace & Risk Intelligence applications. Collaborates effectively with other team members to implement necessary updates in a timely way and may be required to populate and maintain databases as required.
Participates on new application development projects. Helps to define business rules that determines the display of data in our websites, assists the product owner in writing test scripts that validates business rules, and performs detailed and rigorous testing to ensure data quality. Active contributor to project team.
Develops a deep understanding of the applications in the Marketplace & Risk Intelligence portfolio and data contained within these applications so quality control procedures and testing will be successful.
Assists in the assessment of acquiring new data sources. Provides input on and advocates for future initiatives/projects/tools.
Reports directly to the Marketplace & Risk Intelligence Managing Director. Assists with managing the Marketplace & Risk Intelligence team operations and portfolio of applications.
Manages work of Market Intelligence data analyst(s). Helps set direction of analyses performed by analyst, provides coaching, guidance, and reviews work for quality.
Able to develop data strategies, considering the information lifecycle as well as organization-specific architectures, policies, practices and procedures
Develops a solid understanding of the data used in Market Intelligence applications, and clearly understands what business problems are being solved.
“Owns’ the Market Intelligence Company database. Responsible for maintaining quality and developing strategies/enhancements to improve quality.
Manages compliance with internal Deloitte policies, technology controls, governance and procedures.
Leads/performs testing and reviews to ensure completeness and accuracy of data/content and ensure that business needs are met.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned.

The team
Our audits are fueled by more than just technology – what really sets us apart are our insightful professionals, collaborative culture, and commitment to innovation and continuous improvement. Our audit professionals apply a streamlined, intelligent approach to the audit, enabled by innovative tools and technologies. Quality is our top priority, and by focusing on innovation, we continue to raise the bar on quality and deliver greater value to our clients. Learn more about Deloitte Audit.

How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, we believe in professional development and helping our people grow. We offer learning opportunities to help you sharpen your skills in addition to
hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. We support the development of leadership and technical skills through leading-edge learning development solutions. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center

Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.

Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. Title: Business Intelligence Analyst I
Skills:
Associate/Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
3+ years of relevant experience in a reporting role
Proficient using SQL and relational databases, in particular extracting data with complex queries
Strong Excel skills, including pivot tables, lookups, data analysis and data connections
Experience building reports using BI tools (Powerbi experience is a plus)
Advanced analytical skills that demonstrate ability to learn how to navigate systems, access data, reconcile numbers from different sources, identify discrepancies and understand drivers of change within data
Capacity to quickly assimilate complex information and provide analysis tailored to suit the audience
Exceptional attention to detail to both content and presentation of information, and avoids complacently with routine processes
Ability to work and communicate effectively with technical and non-technical business teams around the world
Displays intellectual curiosity to challenge the status quo and tackle challenging problems
FullDescriptions:
Business Intelligence Analyst I

Job Description:
The Business Intelligence team develops, executes and enhances a suite of reports that allows our business partners to effectively manage Stearns Lending portfolio. The team is focused on automation and uses BI tools such as Powerbi and Salesforce to efficiently deliver timely and accurate information.
In addition to regular reporting the BI reporting analyst responds to ad-hoc requests for information by asking pertinent, clarifying questions, identifying the relevant data needed to satisfy the request and presenting the information to the requester in a clear and concise manner.
We follow best practice for reporting and data management and the successful candidate should be comfortable working in an environment with strong reporting governance and controls. This role is based in Lewisville, Texas.
We strive to automate all our reporting and processes and want the BI reporting analyst to have a process improvement mindset, be resourceful and a problem solver.
Required Skills and Experience:
Associate/Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
3+ years of relevant experience in a reporting role
Proficient using SQL and relational databases, in particular extracting data with complex queries
Strong Excel skills, including pivot tables, lookups, data analysis and data connections
Experience building reports using BI tools (Powerbi experience is a plus)
Advanced analytical skills that demonstrate ability to learn how to navigate systems, access data, reconcile numbers from different sources, identify discrepancies and understand drivers of change within data
Capacity to quickly assimilate complex information and provide analysis tailored to suit the audience
Exceptional attention to detail to both content and presentation of information, and avoids complacently with routine processes
Ability to work and communicate effectively with technical and non-technical business teams around the world
Displays intellectual curiosity to challenge the status quo and tackle challenging problems
Desired Skills and Experience:
International reporting experience
Proficient using one or more of SAS, Tableau, Powerbi or SSAS
Familiar with data management and data governance
Experience working with an Agile development process and collaborating with technology partners
Experience with Data modeling (Tabular and Cube)

Title: Data Science/Process Yield, Intern
Qualifications:
To be successful the candidate should have strong background in data analytics and mathematics.
Knowledge of databases, data structure, data transformation, data mining and statistical analysis.
Experience with programming languages such as Java, R, Python.
Knowledge in engineering, semiconductor physics and statistics is desirable.
Must have a 3.0 GPA or Higher
Currently enrolled in B.S, MS, or PhD in Science, Statistics or Math. Bachelors of Science or higher in Engineering or computer science with emphasis on data science or analytics.
Responsibilities:
Candidate will work with the yield enhancement engineering team to create models of available data to the key fab metrics.
They will assist with restructuring of the data as necessary to support improved correlations and ability to successfully generate actionable models for continuous improvement.
Will assist working with other engineering departments to validate model performance and generate appropriate improvement efforts to drive operational gains.
FullDescriptions:
Site: TX - Richardson
Business Title: Data Science/Process Yield, Intern
Shift: Normal Day


At Qorvo, our vision is to do more than create innovative RF solutions for the mobile, defense and infrastructure markets. We are helping to innovate and shape the future of wireless communications. For interns or college students like you, that means having access to amazing career-building opportunities. Whether you are interested in engineering, planning, research, marketing or manufacturing, Qorvo is large enough to engage you in many learning opportunities yet small enough for you to make a direct impact. Join our culture of innovation and enjoy how Qorvo is connecting the world by shaping and launching the next generation of RF solutions. Our mission at Qorvo starts with our employees. As a unified global team, we bring a commitment to excellence and growth and a passion for creating what's next. Explore the possibilities with us.

This is a full-time position located in Richardson, TX. The position will be temporary in nature and last approximately 3 months, May - August. Must have US Worker Status.
Description: Data Science Engineer Intern at Qorvo, TX high volume semiconductor manufacturing site for state-of-the-art RF solutions. Position will be a member of the Fab Yield team to support improving factory yield through advanced data analytics.

Responsibilities:

Candidate will work with the yield enhancement engineering team to create models of available data to the key fab metrics.
They will assist with restructuring of the data as necessary to support improved correlations and ability to successfully generate actionable models for continuous improvement.
Will assist working with other engineering departments to validate model performance and generate appropriate improvement efforts to drive operational gains.
Qualifications:

To be successful the candidate should have strong background in data analytics and mathematics.
Knowledge of databases, data structure, data transformation, data mining and statistical analysis.
Experience with programming languages such as Java, R, Python.
Knowledge in engineering, semiconductor physics and statistics is desirable.
Must have a 3.0 GPA or Higher
Currently enrolled in B.S, MS, or PhD in Science, Statistics or Math. Bachelors of Science or higher in Engineering or computer science with emphasis on data science or analytics.


NOTE: Because this is a student internship, candidate must be a currently enrolled student in a degree-seeking accredited program.

Please Note: Because this position is located at our Richardson, TX location where we have contracts with the US government, qualified candidates must have US Worker status. This usually means they are a US citizen or hold a green card. Students on visas such as F-1 or J-1 do not qualify. If you hold one of these visas, we encourage you to apply to any of our positions in other company locations.

Title: Senior Business & Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting. From the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe, Nissan exemplifies ingenuity in everything we do. Our people are what drive the business forward.
We’re currently looking for a Senior Business & Data Analyst to join our team at in Irving, Texas.
This role will be responsible for:
Operating within the Business Transformation group, the position acts as the key contributor for a technology team operating between NMAC business departments, NNA Information Systems and third party technology vendors to source, develop, launch and administer Software as a Service (SaaS) systems.
The position is a lead SME role using systems expertise and experience to deliver project milestones and systems service levels.
The position is a key driver in the evolution of NMAC’s business systems Center of Excellence supporting all NMAC business functions and is a key contributor to the evolving NMAC business systems strategy.
Job functions include but are not limited to:
Key individual contributor and SME in a business systems technology team operating between NMAC business departments, NNA IS and third party technology vendors to develop, launch and administer NMAC SaaS systems. Conduct ongoing systems strategy meetings with NMAC business department leadership to identify technology needs and provide consultative support.
Act as a project leader and facilitate business process design discussions with NMAC business departments, NNA IS, RNPO and third party vendors during systems RFI/RFP projects.
Bring an expert level of business analysis competency utilizing up–to-date best practices and techniques that will provide sound technical recommendations and solutions.
Develop, launch, and build-out plans for associated SaaS systems including user, process and training documentation. Deliver milestone updates and proposals to NMAC business department leadership gaining consensus and needed approvals. Ensure project alignment with NMAC business systems strategy, legal requirements, compliance guidelines and NNA IS requirements / strategies. Perform as a team leader for departmental staff.
SME and key individual contributor for the NMAC Credit Operations Loan Originations System (LOS). Develop a functional and systems focused SME team through direct integration with the SaaS suppliers, NNA IS and business department leadership to support and administer the systems post launch.
Develop system operational service plans delivering performance and service levels identified by business department leadership. Includes but not limited to system process documentation, ongoing enhancement mapping, system issue resolution plans, and vendor performance measurement. Initiate and lead to develop solutions of new industry technology as a key input to the NMAC business systems strategy.
Minimum Qualifications:
A Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university is required.
Seven to Ten (7-10) or more years of directly related professional level sales finance or lending experience with an origination and funding function focus
Extensive knowledge all aspects of automotive sales finance operations from origination to collections.
Expert level knowledge of sales finance systems including SaaS systems.
Proficient skills in office suite, project management and collaboration software.
Infrequent day and overnight travel.
Welcome to an open lane of possibility. Drive your career forward and join the company leading the technology and business evolution of the automotive industry by applying today.
Nissan is committed to a drug-free workplace. All employment is contingent upon successful completion of a drug screen for roles based in the United States and background screening for all positions.
All of us at Nissan – regardless of functional area or expertise – share a passion to design, manufacture, and sell high-performance vehicles. It is Nissan’s policy to provide Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, gender, military status, disability, or any other status protected by law.
Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work in the United States and will be required to provide proof of employment eligibility at the time of hire.
**Visa sponsorship for this position is not available at this time.**
Irving Texas United States of America
