Title: Data Analyst
Responsibilities:
Design and develop reporting assets utilizing multiple data sources, business intelligence tools (including Tableau), and native charting and analysis tools to provide consistent, reliable, and automated delivery to the end user
Conduct data discovery, analysis, and profiling of data to validate business performance and provide inputs for process and operational improvement initiatives
Identify and manage data quality or integrity issues and collaborate with peer organizations to design data solutions, as well as plan their implementation
Explore new ways to present data insights to end users in BI tools and work with our product team to suggest data driven visualizations in our web and mobile applications.
Manage reporting commitments to internal and external stakeholders and help develop and maintain the structure of our reporting environment
Work with cross-functional teams to develop key performance indicators (KPIs) used to manage the business
FullDescriptions:
The promise of a connected future requires increasingly complex networks that are capital intensive to build. Stonecrop Technologies, established in 2001, leverages software, mobile technology and supply chain expertise to reduce the cost and time required to develop, build and maintain telecommunications networks. Stonecrop continues to disrupt the way communications networks are deployed through a system of coordinated software applications and processes that align network design, supply chain, and installation. Operating a national integrated logistics network with nearly 2 million square-feet of distribution space across 90+ U.S. cities, our employees embody our company values: teamwork, innovation, and self-directed initiative.

The Data Analyst role requires a candidate that possesses a combination of systems knowledge, data analysis skills, and an outgoing, people-focused personality. You will work on site, full time with external and internal teams, helping them draw meaningful conclusions from our data and inform business decisions to support strategic priorities.

A successful candidate will have proven experience in generating insight and recommendations through reporting, dashboards and visualization of large, complex data sets. In your role, you will be a key player in a multi-functional team to deliver insights with a direct and measurable impact. To this end, you will facilitate collaboration across internal teams to drive meaningful change in areas which need improvement.

Interaction with Planning, Sourcing, Operations, and Engineering will be paramount. Working with geographically dispersed co-workers and clients will enable the candidate to gain vast experience in a global network and challenge them to maintain exceptional organizational and prioritization skills.

Responsibilities include:

Design and develop reporting assets utilizing multiple data sources, business intelligence tools (including Tableau), and native charting and analysis tools to provide consistent, reliable, and automated delivery to the end user
Conduct data discovery, analysis, and profiling of data to validate business performance and provide inputs for process and operational improvement initiatives
Identify and manage data quality or integrity issues and collaborate with peer organizations to design data solutions, as well as plan their implementation
Explore new ways to present data insights to end users in BI tools and work with our product team to suggest data driven visualizations in our web and mobile applications.
Manage reporting commitments to internal and external stakeholders and help develop and maintain the structure of our reporting environment
Work with cross-functional teams to develop key performance indicators (KPIs) used to manage the business

Job Requirements


Bachelor’s degree
2-3 years of experience in a Data Analyst role.
Strong user experience knowledge.
Recent proven experience developing data visualizations, dashboards, and reporting in Tableau - minimum 1-year experience required
Experience with SQL (PostgreSQL) required; Python preferred, knowledge of Pandas and other python analysis and visualization libraries is a bonus.
Telecommunications industry experience a plus

Additional Details


Self-starter with demonstrated ability to show initiative and work independently
Ability to operate comfortably and effectively in a fast-paced, highly cross-functional environment while embedded with the client
Ability to communicate results of analyses in a clear and effective manner - in both internal and external settings
Ability to work effectively with partners to meet the data needs of the business, translating business needs into analytical requirements
Ability to communicate over different time zones with remote employees and clients
Familiarity with agile methods such as scrum
Knowledge of project management techniques and best practices
Supply chain experience a plus
Travel disposition – 15-25 % of the time

Stonecrop Technologies LLC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Title: Healthcare Data Analyst
Qualifications: 2+ years in healthcare data eligibility, insurance, IT, benefits or data analytics environment with a strong ability to work independently, problem solve, and analyze data in a confidential healthcare environment
FullDescriptions:
CVS/Caremark,the Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM) division of CVS Health, is looking for a Healthcare Data Analyst to join our Eligibility Administration Department. As a Healthcare Data Analyst for a Fortune 10 organization, you will impact and support customers in all areas including Commercial, Medicare, Healthcare Plans & Group Waiver Plans (EGWP).

Primary responsibilities of the Healthcare Data Analyst include:
Acting as a healthcare data subject matter expert on Eligibility guidelines and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) protocol for clientsResearching and consulting to improve healthcare data integrity and ensure excellent service deliveryConstantly improving healthcare analytical skills that are needed to perform data analysisResolving data enrollment issues on a daily basisConsulting on healthcare data needsHaving exceptional time management and healthcare client management skillsContinuous development training will be provided in this role to ensure the Healthcare Data Analyst is able to exceed client expectations in this fast-paced environment

Required Qualifications
2+ years in healthcare data eligibility, insurance, IT, benefits or data analytics environment with a strong ability to work independently, problem solve, and analyze data in a confidential healthcare environment

Preferred Qualifications
3+ years in eligibility or other relevant background2+ years customer service or client-facing experience in a fast-paced environmentExperience in EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)Understanding of the PBM industryExperience in a healthcare client facing roleExperience in a fast paced environmentKnowledge of ANSI X12 834 Data DocumentsFamiliarity with RxClaim and/or AS400

Education
Bachelor's Degree Preferred or Equivalent Work Experience

Business Overview
It’s a new day in health care.

Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all.

We offer a diverse work experience that empowers colleagues for career success. In addition to skill and experience, we also seek to attract and retain colleagues whose beliefs and behaviors are in alignment with our core values of collaboration, innovation, caring, integrity and accountability.

CVS Health is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Gender/Ethnicity/Disability/Protected Veteran – we highly value and are committed to all forms of diversity in the workplace. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities. We comply with the laws and regulations set forth in the following EEO is the Law Poster: EEO IS THE LAW and EEO IS THE LAW SUPPLEMENT. We provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance to apply for this job, please contact our Advice and Counsel Reasonable Accommodations team. Please note that we only accept applications for employment via this site.

If technical issues are preventing you from applying to a position, contact Kenexa Helpdesk at 1-855-338-5609 or cvshealthsupport@us.ibm.com. For technical issues with the Virtual Job Tryout assessment, contact the Shaker Help Desk at 1-877-987-5352.

Experience with R, SAS, or Python preferable

Exceptional analytical skills and strong business acumen
Outstanding communication skills with the ability to influence decision makers and build consensus with teams
Project Management skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and key deadlines

FullDescriptions:
Overview
We are looking for a hands-on Senior Product Analyst who is a creative problem solver with a passion to deliver advanced data-driven solutions. You will work alongside product managers and marketers to grow professional tax business at Intuit.

We are seeking a Senior Product and Data Analyst who will partner with our online product and marketing teams and drive profitable growth. As a senior member of the analytics team, you will have a strong track record of combining advanced analytics skills, knowledge of product analytics and exceptional business and analytical acumen.

Partner with product managers, marketing, and sales to transform business questions into fact-based analyses that deliver clear insights and actionable recommendations to improve and accelerate product/feature adoption
Develop a deep understanding of the Professional Tax Group ecosystem and be able to identify and analyze the impact of marketing and product changes on customer behavior, acquisition and retention.
Design and execute complicated and structured analyses from beginning to end, combining data from multiple sources, resulting in accurate and impactful findings for the organization
Create dashboards to understand key drivers of growth/conversion and proactively come up with ideas to improve customer experience.
Communicate analytical findings and recommendations in a clear and concise way to non-technical audiences, both in oral and written presentations.
Use Hypothesis-driven approach to drive setup and analysis of A/B tests, and provide recommendations based on the test performance.
Work closely with product management and engineering teams to help optimize data structure and validate data integrity; Execute plans to gather data and develop practical solutions through qualitative and quantitative analyses
Develop predictive models and other tools to help us better predict events such as conversion and churn
Automate reporting to be self-serve and improve processes to increase efficiency

5+ years relevant experience with a proven track record of leveraging analytics to drive significant business impact.
Advanced SQL skills and proficiency in visualization tools such as Tableau
Experience with R, SAS, or Python preferable
Experience working with granular web clickstream data and behavior tracking tools like Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics or equivalent.
Experience with testing tools such as Optimizely, SiteSpect, or Adobe Test & Target
Exceptional analytical skills and strong business acumen
Outstanding communication skills with the ability to influence decision makers and build consensus with teams
Project Management skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and key deadlines
Bachelor degree in Business, engineering, Math, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or a related field. MBA or graduate degree in a related field a plus

Title: Data Analyst - Loan Boarding

Two+ years of recent experience as a data analyst, report developer, or another related title in a financial or banking environment
Experience creating and maintaining dashboards for KPI metrics and other performance measurables, preferred
Strong proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite package including an expert knowledge of Excel
Two to three years of recent experience with Visual Basic or similar programming languages
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Business Administration
Responsibilities:
Interpret client requirements into actionable specifications
Mine, analyze, and interpret data from multiple sources
Create import and export maps from external data sources
Develop data validation rules to ensure quality data
Create Visual Basic scripts to manage external data
Perform tests for validity, reasonableness, and accuracy through standard methods and application of specific subject-area knowledge
Troubleshoot data inconsistencies
Perform regular maintenance and testing on production reports and dashboards
Provide ad-hoc reporting and analysis services as required to meet business needs
FullDescriptions:
Position Summary:
The Data Analyst – Loan Boarding will be responsible for day-to-day production, maintenance, and development of the loan onboarding process and data solutions at RoundPoint. This role will focus on understanding business processes and data, interpreting client requirements and specifications, and developing meaningful analyses and reports to drive business decisions. Qualified candidates will have a proven background performing data mining, analysis, and reporting.

Working Relationships:
The Data Analyst – Loan Boarding role reports to the Loan Boarding Manager in the Loan Administration department. This role works closely with members of the Loan Boarding and Loan Administration teams and other internal stakeholders to fulfill client and investor inquiries.

Primary Responsibilities:

Interpret client requirements into actionable specifications
Mine, analyze, and interpret data from multiple sources
Create import and export maps from external data sources
Develop data validation rules to ensure quality data
Create Visual Basic scripts to manage external data
Perform tests for validity, reasonableness, and accuracy through standard methods and application of specific subject-area knowledge
Troubleshoot data inconsistencies
Perform regular maintenance and testing on production reports and dashboards
Provide ad-hoc reporting and analysis services as required to meet business needs

Qualifications:
The right candidate will be flexible, action and results oriented, self-starting, have strong analytical skills, and be comfortable with a Microsoft Excel-driven environment. He or she must have a proven track record in analyzing and compiling data from multiple sources as well as creating reports for an executive management audience.

Required


Two+ years of recent experience as a data analyst, report developer, or another related title in a financial or banking environment
Experience creating and maintaining dashboards for KPI metrics and other performance measurables, preferred
Strong proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite package including an expert knowledge of Excel
Two to three years of recent experience with Visual Basic or similar programming languages
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Business Administration

Desired


Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with both internal and external customers, peers, and management
Ability to adapt to new, changing technologies used in day-to-day production tasks.

RoundPoint's Employee Value Proposition:
A team where quality is required, hard work is rewarded, and wins happen.

Our mission is to serve our homeowners and all of their homeownership needs. We do this by embracing challenges, executing with excellence, and fostering a positive work culture that encourages personal and professional growth. We are on the fast track to becoming the premier marketplace for all things home, and the National Mortgage News and Best Companies Group just named us one of 2019's Best Mortgage Companies to Work For! Without a doubt, RoundPointers are what make this company a great place to work! That's why we hire individuals who share our core values: Energy, Ethics, Execution, Everyone, and Earn it!

As a RoundPointer, we will empower you to innovate, provide meaningful solutions, set goals and crush them, play hard, and give back to the community! Our secret sauce is our mantra, All In. All Win. Together, we can achieve great things!

Physical Demands and Work Environment:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job:


The employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
The employee is required to sit for extended periods of time and is occasionally required to stand and walk.
The employee must regularly use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects and is regularly required to reach with hands and arms; the employee may occasionally climb or balance, and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, and ability to adjust focus.
The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate, and no extreme conditions are present.

Title: Data Analyst (Power Trading)
FullDescriptions:
About the team:
Capco is a fully independent, global management and technology consultancy providing services to the Financial Services and Energy industries. For nearly 20 years we have combined innovative thinking with deep industry knowledge to deliver business consulting, digital transformation and technology services to our clients. Our collaborative and efficient approach helps clients reduce costs and manage risk and regulatory change while increasing revenues. We are thinkers, innovators, and disruptors. We are small enough to care but large enough to matter.

About the Job:
This position involves analysis, design, and consulting support, as well as developing an understanding of our clients’ strategic direction, issues, and project goals. The successful candidate must have Power Marketing Operations experience with trading, settlements, and financial instruments used in various markets (ERCOT, ISO-NE, MISO, PJM, NYISO, CAISO) and familiarity with bids, offers, and awards processes in various Power Markets.

What You’ll Get to Do:
P&L Reporting
Conduct data analysis in Power Trading market
Gas trading data analysis
Conduct Physical and Financial Gas and Power trades
Data analysis of ISO operations and settlements

What You’ll Bring with You:
2+ years of Data Analysis experience
1+ year of experience working at a professional services consulting company
1+ year of experience working in Power Trading environment
Bachelor’s degree required with a major in MIS, Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Business or Financial Engineering preferred. (An advanced degree is desirable)
Data Analyst skills, including experience interviewing client executives to gather and document business requirements and process mapping
Strong presentation skills

Why Capco?
You will join a company that supports and encourages an entrepreneurial outlook and independent thinking. Capco is not about organizational charts and layers – we operate with little hierarchy because we want all employees to feel that Capco is their firm.

We offer highly competitive benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan, tuition reimbursement, and a work culture focused on innovation and creation of lasting value for our clients and employees.

Ready to get started?
If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. This is an opportunity to make a difference and contribute to a highly successful company with a significant growth trajectory.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Analytics team!

What's the team like?

Our team's mission is to use data to deliver long-term strategic insights. We also provide short-term guidance on A/B tests, user behavior etc. We leverage data to understand our users: what they need, what they do, how to retain them and ultimately how to help them find the best dates.

We also work to support business trends/forecasting, model the impact of new product ideas on Revenue/EDITDA and other metrics.

What's my day-to-day?

You will help guide Match's product decisions by crunching large data sets, analyzing, building models and driving key insights. You'll also work with other cross-functional teams like Finance, CRM, Engineering and Business Intelligence.


Provide internal consulting to product management, marketing and CRM teams on A/B tests as they move from initiatives from concept to market
Identify strategic opportunities to apply data science where it will offer cross functional benefits
Provide key insights to internal customers on their specific ad-hoc needs
Serve as the subject matter expert on applying various statistical methodologies towards distilling actionable insights
Research issues about customer behavior/changes by analyzing relevant metrics, trends etc. supporting enterprise level initiatives
Assist with conducting member market research - design questionnaires, analyze data and provide meaningful insights

What skills is Match looking for?


3+ years of SQL (T-SQL preferred)
Exposure to applied statistics (descriptive statistics, statistical testing, design of experiments, linear modelling, time series analysis etc); Python/SPSS/SAS/R experience a strong plus
Hands on experience with ML platforms such as tensorflow highly desirable
Advanced Excel knowledge
Excellent problem solving skills
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering / related field, Marketing, or MBA with quantitative focus
Self-starter with good communications skills
Experience in consumer internet preferred
applicants will be required to complete a SQL and Data Analysis skills assessment test

Why Match?

A lot of businesses say they change lives, but we actually do it. We've helped millions of people find love and happiness.


You can wear jeans every day
Our benefits and perks are pretty amazing
Drinks and snacks are on us every single day
We have happy hours monthly, so there's always something to celebrate

A positive attitude
Ability to deliver our lesson plans that are taught in classrooms across the country to the student body
Share your own professional experiences and industry insight with the students
Support our students individually as they go through an emotional roller coaster
Be able to infuse empathy, support, encouragement, and fun into the student experience
FullDescriptions:
Trilogy Education partners with universities to offer programs in Web Development, Data Analytics, UX/UI Design, and Cybersecurity. Our platform combines a market-driven curriculum, robust career services, and a multinational community of universities, instructors, and employers to prepare adult learners for careers in the digital economy.

Our programs have been in existence since 2015, and since then, we've launched an additional 300 classes across the nation. We have hired more than 1,900 Instructors and Teaching Assistants to support our students.

The Job:
We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to teach our part time Data Analytics and Visualization class at Southern Methodist University. Our instructors are an essential piece to our students experience with us. You must bring a positive attitude and be able to infuse empathy, support, encouragement and fun into the classroom. As an instructor you will need to have the ability to deliver our lesson plans that are being taught across the country; while at the same time sharing your own professional experiences and industry insight with the students.

Our Data Analytics and Visualization Program:
For too many companies, Big Data isn't the solution to a problem—Big Data is the problem. The Data Analytics and Visualization course provides learners with the knowledge, skills, and expertise to turn data, into insights, and into actionable recommendations to improve processes and drive company growth. Starting with Microsoft Excel⎼and advancing through Python, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, API Interactions, Social Media Mining, SQL, Hadoop, Tableau, Advanced Statistics, Machine Learning, R, Git/GitHub, and more⎼students work their way through the industry's most popular programming languages, software, and libraries in data analytics.

Why teach with us?

Are you passionate about education and making an impact? Do you love empowering others to find life-changing opportunities. We'd love to hear from you! If you bring knowledge, strong communication, and a positive energy to the classroom, you're going to help our students along their transformative path to a successful and rewarding career. Prior teaching experience isn't a prerequisite for success as an Instructor or Teaching Assistant within Trilogy.

We'll provide the guidance, training, lesson plans, and tools to support you on your journey of impacting lives in the classroom.

What You Will Do:

Lead lectures and educational coding activities
Answer questions from the stage
Walk around the classroom during coding activities and in-class projects to assist the students, as needed
Ensure Panopto is turned on and actively recording the class lecture to help us continuously improve
Upload all class content to Students Git Repository
Create Homework Assignments in Bootcampspot
Ensure that homework is graded on-time; and occasionally assist with grading

Technology Language Skills:

Python Pandas
Matplotlib
Beautiful Soup
JavaScript
HTML5
CSS3
D3
Leaflet
SQL, noSQL
Tableau
Machine Learning, Hadoop

What makes you a great fit (Requirements):

Bachelor's Degree
Minimum of 5 years of work experience
A positive attitude
Ability to deliver our lesson plans that are taught in classrooms across the country to the student body
Share your own professional experiences and industry insight with the students
Support our students individually as they go through an emotional roller coaster
Be able to infuse empathy, support, encouragement, and fun into the student experience

Mon/Wed/Sat OR Tue/Thu/Sat Schedule
Weekday Classes: 5:45pm - 10pm (includes office hours and break)
Saturday Classes: 9:30am - 2:30pm (includes office hours and lunch break)

FullDescriptions:
Job Description:
Basic Function

Position Background

The Analyst, Community Health Evaluation is a member of the Data Science & Impact team within Komen’s Mission division. The Data Science and Impact team supports Komen’s role as an evidence-based organization by transforming data into meaningful intelligence that will guide program strategy, convey Komen’s impact and facilitate the use of data to fuel scientific discoveries and improve breast cancer outcomes.


Position Summary

The primary objective of the Analyst, Community Health is to support Susan G. Komen in achieving our overall Vision and Mission by:


Monitoring progress and evaluating the impact of community-based public health programs designed to alleviate barriers to health care and reduce deaths from breast cancer and assessing alignment of mission activities with Komen's mission strategy.
Implementing and maintaining the ongoing coding and categorization of Komen's grants and other mission related programs using established classification systems.
Monitoring trends and developments in community health evaluation methods and their application.
Developing, writing and/or editing communication pieces for multiple audiences to communicate the outcomes and impacts as determined by the Evaluation Team.
Providing accurate information to the Development teams to support efforts to raise funds in support of the Bold Goal.
Promoting an organizational culture that values trust, commitment to the mission, scientific integrity, and professional and organizational growth.
Primary Responsibilities

Duties and Responsibilities:
Monitoring progress and evaluating the impact of community-based public health programs designed to alleviate barriers to health care and reduce deaths from breast cancer and assessing alignment of mission activities with Komen's mission strategy.

Conducts ongoing coding and classification of Komen’s Community Health grants, programs and activities using designated coding systems including the Community Health Classification System and other program classification systems
Contributes to evaluation studies and portfolio analyses
Develops strategies to identify measurable outcomes from Komen-funded programs and projects
Retrieves and analyzes data from multiple internal and public database(s)
Analyzes both qualitative and quantitative data
Provides support to inter-and intra-departmental teams to build Komen Headquarters, Field Offices and Affiliate Network capacity.
Works with Komen’s Evaluation team to develop and implement approaches to improve the capacity of Komen Headquarters, Field Offices and Affiliates to use the tools, frameworks, and skill-sets associated with program monitoring and evaluation (logic models, program plans, measurable objectives, benchmarks, etc.) to develop, implement, evaluate, and improve programs.
Provides training and assistance to Headquarters, Field Offices and Affiliates to incorporate program evaluation into their mission activities and to use the results of program evaluation to improve mission delivery (e.g. grantmaking, contract services, program implementation)
Contributes to the development and implementation of reporting tools including the integration of metrics and program outcomes into existing data systems as well as the identification, development and adaptation of new systems
Assists with developing and delivering high-impact training for staff, grantees and the organization’s Affiliates.
Identifies gaps and weaknesses in current evaluation processes/procedures utilizing methods appropriate for each situation.
Strategically develops evaluation processes for Research-related projects using evidence-based practices and theories.
Must be able to clearly communicate and teach others in order to increase their analytical skills.
Identifies innovative approaches to program and portfolio evaluation and impact assessment.


Works closely with both the Mission and Evaluation teams to categorize Komen's grants and other mission-related programs using established classification systems, as well as maintain the ongoing coding.

Works with other Evaluation team members to establish definitions for internal coding systems and inclusion/exclusion criteria and validate code assignments.
Reviews and codes Komen research grants to facilitate portfolio evaluation. Creates and manages project databases, as needed.
Monitors the processes required for on-going maintenance of the above structured database(s)
Contributes to the communication of the outcomes and impact of Susan G. Komen's research portfolio for multiple audiences.

Researches and prepares responses to requests for information on Komen Community Health programs, processes, grant mechanisms, etc.
Develops and updates current mission-based communication resources including project/program summaries, talking points, and website content, as appropriate.
Coordinates with the Evaluation team and Grants Administration team to prepare tables, charts and figures for internal and external reports, as required.
Synthesizes information from multiple sources, including reports, publications, presentations, articles, and the experiences of others in the field, including staff and volunteers of Komen Affiliates.
Works collaboratively across Komen departments to help secure funding mission programs and ensure donor stewardship.
Contributes to the development of donor proposals, pitch documents, presentations, and other materials to assist in revenue-generating activities seeking support for mission programs.
All other duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications:
Minimum Experience Required

Educational and Experience Requirements

Master’s degree in public health required. 3-5 years of experience implementing and/or evaluating public health programs is required.
Minimum Requirements


A Master’s Degree in the human services field, public health, business or public administration
Experience in mixed methods evaluation, community-based participatory research, data collection techniques, and data analysis.
Experience evaluating community health programs including developing evaluation plans, conducting data collection and analyses, ensuring data quality, and using evaluation results to inform programmatic decisions and demonstrate programmatic impact.
Ability to see projects through from conception to completion; demonstrated ability to identify problems and follow through until resolution.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, set priorities, and collaborate with team members.
Strong communication skills, written and oral.
Ability to work independently and autonomously but also function well in a collaborative team setting, working across functions and different types of people
Demonstrated expertise in managing working relationships in a matrix structure


Preferred Experience

Experience teaching others in order to increase their analytical skills.
Experience with Excel and data visualization applications
Experience conducting literature reviews
Ability to travel
Demonstrated experience in client communication including but not limited to written, oral and electronic reports.
Specialized Knowledge Requirements

Title: CDI Engineer
FullDescriptions:
JOB SCOPE & PURPOSE
The Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the creation and execution of marketing, reporting and analytics processes as defined by client. He/she is a subject matter expert on client's data sources and become intimately familiar with database, email and preference data including understanding key business rules that drive data outputs.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Technically able to understand and create complex ETL processes.
Work hand-in-hand with client
Effectively utilizes programming tools and applications (SQL, Informatica, and Oracle).
Plays a role in thought leadership and uses strong consultative skills.
Monitors quality control on deliverables prior to client distribution. Ensures the client team is following quality control procedures as applicable
Based on business requirements, contributes to detailed technical requirements and specifications; identifies missing details in the business requirements and engages the appropriate resource(s) for clarification.
Become an internal expert in ETL, CDI and complex Datamart Build services for campaign, reporting and analytics processes.
Develops mapping and data processing procedures to import data from various data sources and populate the client database.
Demonstrates knowledge of the data model and the data, to provide insights and recommendations.
Develops data extracts and procedures to support internal and client (external) business analytics.
Actively involved in troubleshooting data / data process anomalies and works with the team to efficiently identify solutions.
Coordinates with cross-competency teams to ensure quality deliverables.
Consistently follow best practices and standards defined by the team / organization.
Contributes to the project estimation process.
Multitasks through project execution and prioritizes accordingly, ensuring project deadlines are met and deliverables are completed in a timely fashion.
Assists with the transition from project completion to ongoing production and production support
Communicates requirements and status with other teams and competencies, as required on an ongoing basis.
PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS
Quality and overall impact of deliverables: Strives to achieve executional excellence. Ensures work is completed on time, within the allotted hours, and meets the business requirements. Creates documents in a professional manner. Fulfills all client and project leader needs and requests.
Team and/or client feedback and satisfaction: Develops strong working relationships with other engineers, QA team members, project leaders, and other Targetbase teams. Team members provide praise for work done.
Commitment to vision and guiding principles of agency and competency: Number one focus is on client’s business. Respect for the individual is at the core of all team interactions. Focuses on solutions versus challenges.
Organizational and/or technical knowledge: Has appropriate knowledge of his/her core competency and Targetbase’s integrated service offerings. Has working knowledge of other competencies. Understands the value of Targetbase technology services and its impact on client business.

REQUIRED SKILLS
EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION

Title: Risk Analyst
FullDescriptions:
POSITION DUTIES: Perform statistical and mathematical analysis for reporting and business intelligence purposes and proactively identify ways to add business value. Duties include: analyze data to support and improve business decisions; develop predictive models for credit, fraud, and collections scoring; generate custom reports for presentations for business owners and communicate analysis; automate common reporting processes and build reporting dashboards using Shiny; maintain, utilize, and improve an existing code base written in R and MySQL; handle intermediate level database management tasks; and develop reproducible reports using Markdown.

REQUIREMENTS: Requires a Master’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Mathematics, Information Technology, Analytics, or a related technical field. Requires one year* of experience involving each of the following: data mining using SQL; building and managing a database; R programming including data manipulation, plotting data, and development of predictive models; development of automated reports using Markdown; and development of fraud detection and prevention strategies. *Employer will accept completion of a graduate-level course, thesis, or internship involving the aforementioned skills in lieu of one year of professional work experience.

LOCATION OF EMPLOYMENT: 8585 N Stemmons Fwy, Ste N1000, Dallas, TX, 75247

TO APPLY: Mail resume to Attn: Wallace Campbell, 8585 N. Stemmons Fwy Ste. N-1000, Dallas, Texas 75247. Ref. #78073-2.

Title: Business Analyst
Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent related experience
FullDescriptions:
About European Wax Center
European Wax Center®, a leading beauty lifestyle brand franchise founded in 2004 by the Coba brothers, offers guests a full suite of waxing services, as well as a proprietary line of beauty products in the skincare, body, and brow categories. EWC provides guests with a modern environment for a comfortable and luxurious experiences, which is focused on EWC’s vision of Revealing Beautiful Skin®, through exceptional services by professionally trained and certified waxing experts. So confident in the experience, EWC offers first-time guests a free wax on some of its most popular services. EWC prides itself on its unique franchise business model, and its network of more than 700 centers across the U.S.
About the Role
The Business Analyst is responsible for understanding business needs (current and future business goals), capturing, analyzing and documenting requirements and communicating those requirements with the different business segments or external business partners to ensure proper execution.
A Day in the Life
 Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
 Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies
 Performing requirements analysis on a routine basis.
 Documenting and communicating the results of efforts and improving processes as necessary.
 Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholder and producing useful requirements.
 Assisting with user acceptance testing
 Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users
What Sets You Apart
 Ability to manage competing resources and priorities.
 Ability to closely monitor deliverables and ensure timely completion of projects
 Ability to work with internal teams to ensure that the systems and processes are in place to support the business
 Maintain the organization’s effectiveness and efficiency by defining, delivering and supporting strategic plans for implementing projects.
Education and Experience
 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent related experience
 5+ years of associated work experience
 Practical application ability with Microsoft office or Visio
 Detailed analytical skills
 Jira/Confluence experience a strong plus
This job description is a general description of essential job functions. It is not intended to describe all duties someone in this position may perform. All employees of EWC and operating subsidiaries are expected to perform tasks as assigned by supervisory/management personnel, regardless of job title or routine job duties.

Title: Marketing Operations Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Keysight Marketing is hiring a data analyst to scale up insights that are a foundational element for Marketing transformation. You will be part of the data analysts team whose goal is to build analytics capability that supports the strategy, planning, and execution of marketing activities.
You will need to have a deep competency and experience with data analytics, statistics, modeling, and a good understanding of data science tools, methodologies, and how to apply them to the real world of customer targeting and optimizing ROI.
Responsibilities
Your focus will be generating customer insights the improve online and offline marketing targeting and customer experience
You will also focus on automating reporting that can be easily consumed by different stakeholders
You will consolidate, validate and investigate big data from multiple sources to find and deliver actionable insights to business partners and to upper management to make informed business decisions
You will create data-driven attribution statistical models of Marketing touches and customer responses to measure and maximize ROI
Develop Propensity Score Matching for segmentation of customers

Who You Are
Analytical and international, with a proven track record of expert-level ability in analytical techniques, model development and deployment and high-velocity transactional data
A communicator with strong interpersonal skills, ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization.
A Self-motivator who is highly organized and able to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
A Subject Matter Expert. You have the capacity to use sophisticated analytical thought to exercise judgment and identify innovative solutions and drive data integrity

Required Skills and Qualifications:
BS, MS in a field related to Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or Computer Engineering is required4+ years of work data analyticsExcellent Excel skills, including MarcosStrong competency in R, Python, or SQLComfortable with both structured and unstructured dataExperience with visualization tools such as DOMO or TableauExperience with web analytics tools as Adobe and Google Analytics

Title: Senior Financial/Data Analyst

FullDescriptions:
The NA FSS BU Analyst is responsible for supporting the reporting and analytics for the business unit expenses. This role would also be supporting standard management reporting across Business Units. This role will include responsibilities across: budgeting, forecasting, reporting and analyses in support of business unit Expense Department. The senior financial analyst will be responsible for developing and implementing analytical standards for reporting and modeling KPIs.
As a key financial liaison, the Sr Financial Analyst will partner with the various departments across the business unit.
Key Responsibilities
1. Drive Financial Reporting
Perform the month-to-month financial reporting including research, explanation and resolution of monthly variance
Prepare reporting baseline packages: Close report, CFO month end package, monthly cash trends and audit schedules
Ad-hoc analysis that explains business changes.
Reporting of monthly, quarterly, and annual performance of key business stakeholders.
2. Drive Knowledge transfers
Review and learn activities transferring to NASS FP&A function
Document standard procedure documentations during knowledge transfers
3. Drive standardized reporting across the business unit
Identify opportunities to standardize reporting across businesses
Develop and maintain working relationships with Finance professionals across business units and NA FSS
Complete ad-hoc and special projects as requested by senior leadership

Minimum of 5 years of Finance experience required

Experience with PowerBI or Tableau preferred

Ability to work with a businesses across geographies

Advanced Excel, Proficient PowerPoint
Strong time management and organization skills with flexibility to work in a fast-paced and changing work environment

Position Summary
We're looking for a Data Analyst that can gather and interpret data from various sources and analyze and compare business trends in order to identify improvements.

End-user training on all reporting and other applications as needed.

Title: Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
As part of the Data Management Organization (DMO), the Data Analyst interprets and analyzes data, develops metrics and communicates results to drive key business decisions. They provide a link between raw enterprise data and the business. They analyze data and processes, identify patterns and opportunities to streamline and automate, and build QC processes and reports to inform management of data quality levels and discrepancies.


Determine, implement, and evaluate business metrics and Key Performance Indicators to meet ongoing organizational or customer information needs.
Interact with business users to gather requirements and develops strategies to meet those needs.
Extract, analyze and transform data to support analytics.
Analyze data from various sources, build statistical data models to identify trends and communicate results effectively
Critically evaluate information from multiple sources and clearly indicate quality of final analysis.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge and Skills:
Hands on experience in data modelling, data mining and statistical data analysis techniques using python/R
Strong analytical skills, ability to collect, organize and analyze significant amount of data with accuracy and attention to detail
Hands on knowledge and experience working with reporting tools like PowerBI
Knowledge and experience in machine learning is a plus
Ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders and understand business needs
Professional communication skills (phone, interpersonal, written, verbal, etc.).
Self-motivated, proactive, detail-oriented team player.
Interpretation and completion of verbal and/or written instructions at a proficient level.
Confidentiality and discretion in the performance of all duties and responsibilities.
Education and Experience:
Bachelors Degree Required
0 - 5 years of directly related or closely related experience

Title: Business Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Slalom is a purpose-driven consulting firm that helps companies solve business problems and build for the future, with solutions spanning business advisory, customer experience, technology, and analytics. We partner with companies to push the boundaries of what’s possible—together.

Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, WA, Slalom has organically grown to nearly 6,000 employees. We were named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2018 and are regularly recognized by our employees as a best place to work. You can find us in 28 cities across the U.S., U.K., and Canada.

Job Title:
Business Analyst
Slalom Consulting is seeking a talented, experienced Business Analyst. Working independently under limited supervision, the individual in this role will plan, design, develop, and analyze business plans for complex problems. The primary responsibilities of this role include gathering and coordinating project impact assessments from various groups within a client’s organization; working with stakeholders to understand their business requirements and define project scope; and helping program managers define requirements and successfully track projects throughout their respective lifecycles.

Responsibilities:
Demonstrate a logical, rigorous, and analytical problem-solving approach, leading requirements gathering sessions and preparing and delivering client presentations and work products/prototypes
Manage release schedules, prioritize projects, and ensure adequate resources are available
Attend and lead meetings; provide project status reporting to management; assist with testing scenarios; and validate results
Conduct and document complex business analysis projects
Perform technical analysis to determine present and future business performance
Provide functional advice or training to less-senior business analysts
Occasionally lead direct or indirect employees for specific projects or objectives
Create and execute system test plans

Qualifications:
 3 or more years of business or functional analyst experience in a consulting environment
Bachelor’s degree
Skilled at analyzing complex issues and distilling concepts to clients
Able to proactively identify risks, and drive action to mitigate and resolve issues
Strong analytical and interpersonal communication skills, with the ability to work independently
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage a vast array of information
Broad understanding of the role of data management, information flow, and data governance issues
Experience with market data and vendor integration and management
Able to serve as a liaison between both business and technical teams to drive effective, timely solutions that fulfill both strategic and operational needs
Skilled at defining and documenting business processes and requirements for ongoing system enhancement initiatives

Title: Business & Data Analyst, Operational Transformation
FullDescriptions:
With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting. From the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe, Nissan exemplifies ingenuity in everything we do. Our people are what drive the business forward.
We’re currently looking for a Business & Data Analyst, Operational Transformation to join our team at Nissan Motor Acceptance Corporation in Irving, Texas.
This role will be responsible for:
Responsible for gathering and analyzing data, defining business specifications, and analyzing and documenting business processes.
Responsibilities also include researching, planning, providing strategic support, preparing management, sales and status reports.
Job functions include but are not limited to:
Maintains a repository of performance metrics and generates management reports illustrating statistical data, text and graphics
Provides support to the sales organization through Sales Planning (territory design, optimization, sales force productivity, metrics development) and Sales Management Reporting
Conducts secondary research using a variety of publications, services and health statistic databases
Identifies, evaluates, and documents business needs and objectives, operational processes and procedures, problems and requirements
Recommends operational and process improvements based on efficiencies and available technologies
Produces documentation, including project plans, analytical reports, decision backup, information research reports, budget analysis, training plans, business justifications, and graphics
Prepares standard and ad hoc financial reports and analysis for senior management.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Develop system operational service plans delivering performance and service levels identified by business department leadership. Includes but not limited to system process documentation, ongoing enhancement mapping, system issue resolution plans, and vendor performance measurement.
Initiate and lead to develop solutions of new industry technology as a key input to the NMAC business systems strategy.
Develop conceptual frameworks and apply sound technology, business management and process improvement techniques to development of requirements for integrated, business based technology solutions to operational and service delivery problems and issues;
Facilitate user and cross-functional team meetings, negotiate understanding and build consensus agreements
Assist in performing basic project management and program coordination responsibilities
Work collaboratively with department and Information Technology team members to ensure project accountability and success; set priorities and balance responsibilities for multiple projects and initiatives to ensure timely, high quality results
Read, understand, interpret, explain and apply complex business and technical information, evaluate issues and alternatives and reach sound independent conclusions within established policy guidelines
Communicate clearly and effectively to diverse audiences of technical and non-technical personnel, orally and in writing; prepare clear, concise and comprehensive reports, documentation and other written materials
Use tact and diplomacy when dealing with sensitive, complex and/or confidential issues and situations; establish and maintain highly effective working relationships with all levels of department and IT staff, consultants, vendors, contractors and others encountered in the course of work.
Performs statistical analysis, compiles data into management reports, automates manual functions, assists with fiscal year budget process, and programs customer correspondence.
Fulfills data and contract audit requirements for The Legal Department and Ernst & Young LLP.
Completes quarterly audits of legal compliance notices.
Coordinates projects among departments.
Performs user acceptance testing on assigned projects.
Trains department staff on applicable systems.
Excellent analytical skills to analyze, interpret, and summarize complex data into recommendations for management.
Proven ability to employ a systems perspective in the use of computer hardware and software to improve reporting and processing operations. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office software including spreadsheet and mainframe applications to create specialized applications or products of a highly technical nature.
Knowledge of charts, databases, macros, QMF and all operating systems. Advanced knowledge of query management facility reporting, SQL, Access, and IR (Interactive Reporting – Oracle/Data Warehouse).
Proven ability to employ a systems perspective in the use of computer hardware and software to improve reporting and processing operations.
Minimum Qualifications:
Robust analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to conduct business studies and recommend solutions.
Skill in math, accounting and financial principles.
Excellent writing skills for preparing narrative reports and correspondence.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities and deadlines.
Expertise in Microsoft Excel, Power Point, Power BI and SQL.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Health Administration, Marketing, Finance or related field is required.
Up to three years of experience in cross-functional business analysis and reporting is desirable.
Background in healthcare or clinical experience is a plus.
Cross-Functional business analysis: 6 years (Preferred)
SQL: 2 years (Preferred)
Welcome to an open lane of possibility. Drive your career forward and join the company leading the technology and business evolution of the automotive industry by applying today.
Nissan is committed to a drug-free workplace. All employment is contingent upon successful completion of a drug screen for roles based in the United States and background screening for all positions.
All of us at Nissan – regardless of functional area or expertise – share a passion to design, manufacture, and sell high-performance vehicles. It is Nissan’s policy to provide Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, gender, military status, disability, or any other status protected by law.
Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work in the United States and will be required to provide proof of employment eligibility at the time of hire.
**Visa sponsorship for this position is not available at this time.**
Irving Texas United States of America

Title: Clinical Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Description
SHIFT: No Weekends

SCHEDULE: Full-time

Are you looking for a work environment where diversity and inclusion thrive? Submit your application with HCA Healthcare today and find out what it truly means to be a part of a team.
We are committed to providing our colleagues with the support they need. We offer an array of medical, dental, and vision packages as well as several add-on perks to make your benefits package truly customizable to you. Some of our unique benefits we offer include:
Student Loan Repayment ProgramTuition Reimbursement/Assistance ProgramsMoving, mortgage, and real estate assistance100% matching 401k based on years of serviceIdentity Theft Protection discountsAuto, Home, and Life Insurance optionsAdoption AssistanceEmployee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

We value your contributions. Our employee recognition programs encourage our teams to raise the bar. Come be a part of the change!

As an Inventory Specialist, you will work directly in our facilities receiving and distributing supplies. Our Supply Chain team is dedicated to providing the materials needed to ensure quality care can be delivered to our patients.

The Clinical Analyst is responsible for designing, developing and analyzing supply chain and clinical data as it applies to clinical products, clinical technology and clinical excellence initiatives utilizing business intelligence applications and data analytics. This position will support the Division and Facility Clinical Resource Director by understanding their objectives, data information needs and will translate this information into a format that will improve clinical decision making within HealthTrust Supply Chain Solutions.
In this role you will:
 Benchmarking cost and clinical data through use of applicable business application tools.
 Development of methodologies for performing financial analysis and interpretation of supply chain purchase history data to identify cost reduction opportunities.
 Ongoing tracking and analysis analytics for supply chain initiatives.
 Develops an in-depth knowledge and understanding of appropriate applications such as ClikView Clinical Excellence tool to identify clinical and cost variation.
 Identify, manage and monitor completion of deliverables throughout the project lifecycle.
 Facilitates the organization of project activities into manageable work efforts
 Utilizing a process improvement approach developing, enhancing and sharing solutions to improve data analytics.
 Provide support to the team with additional analysis as requested.
 Adheres to Code of Conduct, Mission & Value Statements
 Participates in special projects as needed and performs other duties as assigned
Qualifications
EXPERIENCE
3-5 years’ experience with managing multiple projects to successful completion that required financial modeling and analysis. Experience is preferred in healthcare financial services, clinical operations, supply chain, or information systems-oriented environments. Must be proficient in the use of all aspects and software provided in the Microsoft Office Suite such as Excel (advanced), Access Database, Power Point presentation development and Visio. Prefer at least one year of related experience in healthcare analytics or economics. Previous experience working in IT product support or product development organization
EDUCATION
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance or Economics or equivalent experience required

HealthTrust is the supply chain solution for the HCA Healthcare. We lead a collection of highly motivated healthcare professionals just like you and creative leaders who are committed to the care and improvement of human life. We have partnered with over 1,600 hospitals for their purchasing needs. Our organization has been continually recognized by Practice Greenhealth as being committed to environmentally responsible practices.
HCA Healthcare is dedicated to the growth and development of our colleagues. We will provide you the tools and resources you need to succeed in our organization. We are actively reviewing applications. Highly qualified candidates will be promptly contacted for interviews. Submit your application and help us raise the bar in patient care!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Procurement & Business Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
The Procurement & Business Data Analyst will be responsible for reporting, analysis, and data visualizations to support sales and various department activities. Ensure the supply chain needs of the company are met in a timely and cost-effective manner. Key role in the company's quarterly forecast and annual budget preparation processes as well as developing relationships with vendors/suppliers and negotiating contract renewals. This opportunity represents Shoppa's Material Handling and requires professionalism, great attitude, good communication skills and outstanding customer service.
Design and build database queries and deliver reports and dashboards using business intelligence tools adhering to established frameworks and standards
Understand business problems and recommend visualization solutions that can be easily interpreted by users
Review costs, develop relationships with vendors and suppliers, negotiate contract renewals and offer suggestions on procuring material and supplies
Actively participate in and influence discussions around reporting requirements, infrastructure needs, and design
Work closely with the business and management teams to understand their data and reporting needs and develop reporting solutions to meet objectives
Assume key role in the company’s quarterly forecast and annual budget preparation processes, and support in the development of complex new business models
Revenue management - analyze & interpret data to identify trends and anomalies; use past performance and future expectations to develop accurate forecasting techniques and provide sales performance KPIs for data-based decision-making process
Other duties and projects as assigned
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in business, Economics, Computer/Data Science, Statistics, or other relevant background
Master’s degree preferred
Experience working with business intelligence tools and data visualization concepts (PowerBI preferred, but other acceptable)
Advanced Excel skills
MS Navision
Proficient in SQL
2+ years of relevant experience
Good communicator and comfortable working with all levels of the organization
Self-motivated & analytical with ability to work in a collaborative, agile team environment with aggressive deadlines and multiple priorities
Must have strong math, analytical, organizational, and communication skills. Positive attitude, well-groomed professional appearance required. MUST be a team player. Must possess negotiation skills and be detail-oriented. Solid demonstrated internal and external customer service skills required. Ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with colleagues, hiring managers, executives, suppliers, and vendors required. Proficiency with Microsoft Office required. Solid presentation skills required.

Title: Senior Human Resource Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Job Description
Are you passionate about solving business problems based on data? If so, Jack Henry & Associates is looking for a Senior Human Resource Data Analyst that will help us to shape our evolving HRIS platforms and reporting processes. This role is extremely data-oriented and requires the manipulation of large amounts of data into meaningful reports. Ideal candidates will need to be able to collaborate across the Human Resources team to identify HR and workforce trends impacting the organization, provide insights into the effectiveness of the HR programs, and improve decision making related to staff programs that will attract, engage and retain key talents. This role will be vital to the HR Data & Analytics function with shaping and executing our HR data analytics strategy.
Working as part of the Human Resources team, this role will report to the Human Resources Business Partner Leader, that aligns business objectives with employees and management across all business units. Candidates will be joining a strong team of HRBPs and subject matter experts related to compliance. Possible travel up to 25% to attend a Jack Henry & Associates meeting or attend a conference.
This position can be hired in Springfield, MO, Allen, TX or Remotely.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 6 years of experience with HR data analysis or HR data reporting.
Minimum 3 years of workforce analytics OR data analysis experience.
Bachelor’s Degree required.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge of HRIS, Learning and Performance Management Software strongly preferred.
Experience with PowerBI, Tableau, and/or similar data analysis, visualization and business intelligence tools preferred.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Builds strong relationships and collaborates with HR Teams, HR Business Partners, and Organizational Leaders to help solve organizational challenges by providing high quality data to assist with making data informed decisions.
Collects, validates, and analyzes large sets of data from multiple sources to identify trends, connect findings, and make strategic and creative recommendations that support the organization’s goals.
Influences change with a “Lead with Data” mindset through data analysis.
Leverages communication and presentation skills, paired with business knowledge, to advise leadership on workforce opportunities and optimize our people investments.
Coordinates the design, development, and implementation of easy to understand reporting solutions (i.e. dashboards, metrics, reports) to report on actuals, predict future needs, and areas of focus to inform, support, and influence Human Resources programs, develop and engage our talent, and support our organizational culture.
Prepares and delivers effective and high-quality presentations to clearly summarize and communicate findings, insights and recommendations.
Supports the evolution of our organizational culture by analyzing and identifying driving factors in organization-wide surveys, including engagement, exiting, onboarding and other data collection methods,
Provides actionable insights based on analysis of attrition, performance data, rewards programs, pay data and other metrics.
Partners with the AAP & EEO Compliance team in generating, validating, and submitting government reporting documents including annual EEO-1 Reporting, annual Vets 4212 reporting, and annual and mid-year Affirmative Action plan data.
Implements the consistent application of workforce data definitions, measurement tools and prioritization of data quality and metrics.
May provide advanced data support such as regression analysis, predictive modeling, and other such methodologies to assist HR leaders in understanding performance and areas of opportunity.
Stays current on trends and best-in-class programs in Human Resources in general and HR Analytics.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Applicants for U.S. based positions with Jack Henry & Associates must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.
Jack Henry & Associates, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and maintains a Drug-Free Workplace.
Females, minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
